{"step_by_step_thinking": "The New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Classification provides a simple way of classifying the extent of heart failure. Class I is for patients with no limitation of physical activity. Class II is for patients with slight limitation of physical activity. Class III is for patients with marked limitation of physical activity. Class IV is for patients who are unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort.
